intro: Stemonurus subrostratus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
